article.title: On the origins of spectral broadening of incoherent waves:Catastrophic process of coherence degradation

choices: The formation of a large-scale coherent soliton.
Unconstrained spectral broadening of two waves with opposite dispersion coefficients.
The thermalization of waves towards the Rayleigh-Jeans equilibrium distribution.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does Figure 2 differ from Figure 1?
choices: It shows the evolution of different wave components.
It displays the spectra on a logarithmic scale.
It uses different initial conditions for the simulations.
It shows the results for waves with positive dispersion coefficients.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the formulas in (9) represent?
choices: The kinetic equations governing the spectral evolution of the waves.
The self-similar solutions of the wave turbulence kinetic equations.
The Rayleigh-Jeans equilibrium distributions for the wave spectra.
The resonant phase-matching conditions for energy and momentum conservation.
The conservation of total kinetic energy in the system.
The linear and opposite power-law behavior of kinetic energies.
The nonlocal nonlinear diffusion of the wave spectra.
The square-root power-law behavior of the spectral width during spectral broadening.
